summary.para: The in_addr structure represents an IPv4 address.
summary.div: Note The IPaddr type definition in IP Helper also represents an IPv4 address and can be cast to an interchangeable structure when needed. The in_addr structure in IP Helper has the same syntax and usage as the Windows Sockets in_addr structure, and is interchangeable with in_addr structure used in Windows sockets. Windows sockets also defines an IN_ADDR typedef for the in_addr structure.

member.name: IPAddr.S_un.S_un_b
member.summary: The IPv4 address of the host formatted as four u_chars.

member.name: IPAddr.S_un.S_un_w
member.summary: The IPv4 address of the host formatted as two u_shorts.

member.name: IPAddr.S_un.S_addr
member.summary: Address of the host formatted as a u_long.
